item.description:
Comments are now available. I’ve created a series of posts for discussing the readings using the comments feature. Markdown-style formatting is enabled, but html tags will be stripped out.

You can write with *italics* and **bold-face** and ~~strike-thru~~. 
[Links](http://example.com) are easy. Paragraphs are separated by a 
blank line.

Blockquotes follow old-fashioned email conventions:

> this is a blockquote.

And lists can be written as

1.  Item 1
2.  Item 2
3.  Item 3

or

*   Item 1
*   Item 2
*   Item 3

Numbered propositions are a special case of numbered lists:

10. Item 10

You can write with italics and bold-face and strike-thru. Links are easy. Paragraphs are separated by a blank line.

Blockquotes follow old-fashioned email conventions:

this is a blockquote.

And lists can be written as

  1. Item 1
  2. Item 2
  3. Item 3

or

  • Item 1
  • Item 2
  • Item 3

Numbered propositions are a special case of numbered lists:

  1. Item 10
